answerText: The Lost Generation[10] This author of A Moveable Feast, a prominent member of the Lost Generation, used World War One as the setting of his novel about Frederic Henry and Catherine Barkley, A Farewell to Arms.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 9 | 9 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: World War One had a major impact on many American authors. For 10 points each: [10] F. Scott Fitzgerald and John Dos Passos are among those included in this group of authors that were active after World War One. Generally, they were Americans living in Europe, and their name was coined by Gertrude Stein.
